explanation:
The report is correct. The call strcmp(bus->name, name) can read past the end of either object if either pointer is NULL or the pointed-to buffer is not NUL-terminated; nothing in the shown function establishes the required guarantees. MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 requires that uses of the <string.h> routines shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the referenced objects. Unless there is an external, provable invariant (not shown here) that both bus->name and name are valid, non-NULL, NUL-terminated strings, this usage is a potential violation of 21.17. The missing logs in the provided test do not refute the theoretical out-of-bounds possibility — they only show the test harness did not exercise a failing case.

Recommended fixes: validate pointers before use (check for NULL), ensure strings are NUL-terminated when created, or use bounded operations (e.g. keep a length field and use memcmp/memcpy with known sizes or use strncmp with an appropriate maximum length derived from the object size) and document the required invariants so static analysis can verify compliance.
